## Introduction

Teal applications are not restricted to `CDISC`-standard data. Although many teal modules included with `NEST` are designed for `CDISC` data, those in the library `teal.modules.general` have been designed to work with unstructured datasets.

For example this application uses the standard `iris` and `mtcars` datasets:

```r
library(teal)
library(teal.data)

app <- init(
  data = teal_data(
    dataset("IRIS", iris, code = "IRIS <- iris"),
    dataset("CARS", mtcars, code = "CARS <- mtcars")
  ),
  modules = modules(
    example_module()
  )
)

shinyApp(app$ui, app$server)
```

## Delayed Data Loading (DDL)

All the features of DDL are available for general datasets:

```r
library(teal.modules.general)
library(dplyr)


person_generator <- function() {
  return(
    data.frame(
      ID = factor(1:8),
      AGE = c(40, 23, 56, 11, 17, 71, 23, 56)
    )
  )
}

pet_generator <- function(){
  return(
    data.frame(
      ID = factor(1:10),
      TYPE = rep(c("CAT", "DOG"), 5),
      COLOR = c("GINGER", rep("BROWN", 5), rep("BLACK", 4)),
      PERSON_ID = factor(c(5, 4, 3, 3, 3, 1, 8, 1, 2, 2))
    )
  )
}


app <- init(
  data = teal_data(
    fun_dataset_connector("PERSON", fun = person_generator, keys = "ID") %>%
      mutate_dataset("PERSON$SEX <- rep(c('M', 'F'), 4)"),
    fun_dataset_connector("PETS", fun = pet_generator, keys = "ID")
  ) %>% mutate_join_keys("PERSON", "PETS", c("ID" = "PERSON_ID")),
  modules = modules(
    tm_t_crosstable(
      x = data_extract_spec(
        dataname = "PERSON",
        select = select_spec(
          choices = variable_choices("PERSON", c("AGE", "SEX")),
          selected = "SEX"
        )
      ),
      y = data_extract_spec(
        dataname = "PETS",
        select = select_spec(
          choices = variable_choices("PETS", c("TYPE", "COLOR")),
          selected = "TYPE"
        )
      )
    ),
    tm_variable_browser()
  )
)

shinyApp(app$ui, app$server)
```
